meanings.definition: A signature added to a document already signed by another person to confirm its authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The countersignature on the contract showed that it was genuine.
meanings.sent2: Please provide your countersignature at the bottom of the form.
meanings.sent3: The countersignature on the will made sure it wasn't a fake.
meanings.sent4: Her countersignature was like a seal of approval on the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The countersignature was the final touch that proved the document's validity.

meanings.definition: To sign a document as a witness to the original signature.
meanings.sent1: I will countersignature the letter to confirm I saw it being signed.
meanings.sent2: The notary will countersignature the deed after you sign it.
meanings.sent3: He had to countersignature the check to make it official.
meanings.sent4: She countersignatured the contract to validate the agreement.
meanings.sent5: Countersignaturing the document was necessary to complete the process.
